com.intel.jndn.utils.client.impl

Class AdvancedClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.jndn.utils.client.impl.SimpleClient
      • com.intel.jndn.utils.client.impl.AdvancedClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client, SegmentedClient, StreamingClient

    public class AdvancedClient
extends SimpleClient
implements SegmentedClient, StreamingClient
    Implementation of a client that can handle segmented data, retries after failed requests, and streaming of data packets.
    Author:
    Andrew Brown

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdvancedClient

        public AdvancedClient(long sleepTime,
                      long interestLifetime,
                      SegmentedClient segmentedClient,
                      RetryClient retryClient,
                      StreamingClient streamingClient)
        Build an advanced client
        Parameters:
        sleepTime - for synchronous processing, the time to sleep the thread between Face.processEvents()
        interestLifetime - the Interest lifetime for default Interests; see SimpleClient.getAsync(net.named_data.jndn.Face, net.named_data.jndn.Name)
        segmentedClient - the SegmentedClient to use for segmented data
        retryClient - the RetryClient to use for retrying failed packets
        streamingClient - the StreamingClient to use for segmented data

      • AdvancedClient

        public AdvancedClient()
        Build an advanced client using default parameters

    • Method Detail

      • getDefault

        public static AdvancedClient getDefault()
        Singleton access for simpler client use
        Returns:
        a default client

      • getAsync

        public CompletableFuture<net.named_data.jndn.Data> getAsync(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                                                            net.named_data.jndn.Interest interest)
        Asynchronously request the Data for an Interest. This will send the Interest and return immediately; with this method, the user is responsible for calling Face.processEvents() in order for the CompletableFuture to complete.
        Specified by:
        getAsync in interface Client
        Overrides:
        getAsync in class SimpleClient
        Parameters:
        face - the Face on which to make the request; call Face.processEvents() separately to complete the request
        interest - the Interest to send over the network
        Returns:
        a future Data packet

      • getSegmentsAsync

        public DataStream getSegmentsAsync(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                                   net.named_data.jndn.Interest interest)
                            throws IOException
        Asynchronously request packets until a FinalBlockId is reached. With this method, the user is responsible for calling Face.processEvents() in order for the data to be retrieved.
        Specified by:
        getSegmentsAsync in interface SegmentedClient
        Parameters:
        face - the Face on which to retry requests
        interest - the Interest to retry
        Returns:
        a data stream of packets returned
        Throws:
        IOException - if the initial request fails

      • getStreamAsync

        public InputStream getStreamAsync(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                                  net.named_data.jndn.Interest interest,
                                  SegmentationType partitionMarker)
                           throws IOException
        Asynchronously request a packet over the network and retrieve the partitioned content bytes as an input stream
        Specified by:
        getStreamAsync in interface StreamingClient
        Parameters:
        face - the Face on which to make the request; call Face.processEvents() separately to complete the request
        interest - the Interest to send over the network
        partitionMarker - the byte marker identifying how the data packets are partitioned (e.g. segmentation, see http://named-data.net/doc/tech-memos/naming-conventions.pdf)
        Returns:
        a stream of content bytes
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream setup fails
